title: What does Graves do now?
body:
Is he still a jungler? An ADC? I'm so confused.

Also please don't tell me he's not viable. I know he's probably not. I'm just trying to get chest attempt on all the champions I own.

replies.body:
Play him jg, bring tons of damage to ganks, outduel the enemy jg, and get fed by how fast you clear the jungle.

He's good in the jg, 100% viable
I know this use to be the case, but is it still?

> [{quoted}](name=BlackKnightJack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aGfivZ7U,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-01-16T22:55:21.163+0000)
>
> I know this use to be the case, but is it still?

I see him in the jungle a lot on Twisted Treeline (aka bruiser/tank land), and he seems to do pretty well, so I don't see why he wouldn't work on Summoner's Rift.

> [{quoted}](name=BlackKnightJack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aGfivZ7U,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-01-16T22:55:21.163+0000)
>
> I know this use to be the case, but is it still?

Have you seen him nerfed? If not, then why wouldn't it be viable?

He can be hard in jungle if you don't understand how to use him there.
As a Shaco main I hate playing against him as the jungler. Take that how you will
But how long ago was this? I know he WAS a good jungler, but I thought the preseason gutted his viability in the jungle (possibly enough to make him go back to being an ADC).
The recent chances to jungle camp exp did nothing but benefit AoE junglers like Graves and Amumu.  You should start seeing more of them as people figure it out.
Alright, so he's still a jungler then.
A damn good one if the player knows how to do it.  Every bit as nasty as he used to be.  Now that he can keep pace in the jungle with the changes to the camps, he'll make a roaring comeback.
He's still nasty in the Jungle and is a viable ADC in the right hands.  He can do both with great success.
